entities.name: INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE
entities.description: The U.S. government agency responsible for tax collection and tax law enforcement. Currently auditing the multinational corporation for fiscal years 2018 and 2019.

entities.name: GERMANY
entities.description: A country in Europe where the multinational corporation is currently under audit.

entities.name: ISRAEL
entities.description: A country in the Middle East where the multinational corporation is currently under audit.

entities.name: INDIA
entities.description: A country in South Asia where the multinational corporation is currently under audit.

entities.name: CONGRESS
entities.description: The legislative body of the United States, responsible for making federal laws. Involved in potential changes to tax laws affecting multinational corporations.

entities.name: ORGANIZATION FOR ECONOMIC COOPERATION AND DEVELOPMENT
entities.description: An intergovernmental economic organization with 38 member countries, founded to stimulate economic progress and world trade. Involved in proposing changes to international tax laws.

entities.name: TCJA
entities.description: The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, a significant tax reform passed in the United States in 2017. Affects multinational corporations by requiring capitalization of research and development expenditures starting in fiscal year 2023.

relationships.relationship_description: Both the Internal Revenue Service and Germany are auditing the multinational corporation.
Both the Internal Revenue Service and Israel are auditing the multinational corporation.
Both the Internal Revenue Service and India are auditing the multinational corporation.
The TCJA is a result of legislative actions by Congress.

relationships.source_entity: ORGANIZATION FOR ECONOMIC COOPERATION AND DEVELOPMENT
relationships.relationship_description: The OECD supports the global minimum tax initiative which could impact the provisions of the TCJA.
